GaborLuminanceStimulus#

Module Contents#

Classes#

GaborLuminanceStimulus

This class constructs the Gabor texture stimulus and selects a patch from it.
class GaborLuminanceStimulus.GaborLuminanceStimulus(dist_scale, contrast_range, spatial_freq, diameter, side_length, grating_res, patch_res)#

This class constructs the Gabor texture stimulus and selects a patch from it.

TODO:: more elaborate explanation + ref.

Parameters

  • dist_scale (float) – how far the circles are from each other.

  • contrast_range (float) – contrast range for the figure.

  • spatial_freq (float) – spatial frequency of the grating (cycles / degree).

  • diameter (float) – annulus diameter (degree).

  • side_length (TODO:: float or int?) – side length (degree) of square stimulus region.

  • grating_res (int) – resolution (number of pixels in a single row) of single grating.

  • patch_res (int) – resolution (number of pixels in a single row) of the stimulus patch.

Raises

AssertionError: if distance between neighbouring annuli is smaller than the diameter of an annulus.

Raises

AssertionError: if the contrast range falls outside of the range \((0, 1]\).

Variables

  • _side_length – side length (degree) of square stimulus region.

  • _patch_res – resolution (number of pixels in a single row) of the stimulus patch.

  • _stim_res – TODO

  • stimulus – the luminance matrix of the full stimulus.

  • stimulus_patch – the luminance matrix of a patch of the stimulus.

plot_stimulus(self, stimulus, filename)#

Plots the binary heatmap of a given stimulus.

Parameters

stimulus (list[list[float]]) – a luminance matrix to plot.

Return type

None

_eccentricity_in_patch(self, point)#

Calculates eccentricity at the given point, that is the distance between that point and the center of stimulus.

Parameters

point ((float, float)) – coordinates of the point (within the stimulus patch).

Returns

eccentricity at the point.

Return type

float

_get_grating(self, spatial_freq, diameter, grating_res)#

Generates a grating (single annulus) of the maximum contrast.

Parameters

  • spatial_freq (float) – spatial frequency of the grating (cycles / degree).

  • diameter (float) – annulus diameter (degree).

  • grating_res (int) – resolution (number of pixels in a single row) of single grating.

Returns

the luminance matrix of the single annulus.

Return type

ndarray[ndarray[float]]

_get_full_stimulus(self, grating, dist_scale, contrast_range, diameter, grating_res)#

Generates the whole stimulus.

Parameters

  • grating (ndarray[ndarray[float]]) – the luminance matrix of the annulus.

  • dist_scale (float) – how far the circles are from each other.

  • contrast_range (float) – contrast range for the figure.

  • diameter (float) – annulus diameter (degree).

  • grating_res (int) – resolution (number of pixels in a single row) of single grating.

Returns

the luminance matrix of a full stimulus.

Return type

ndarray[ndarray[float]]

_get_start_of_patch(self)#

Determines the starting point (left top) of the stimulus patch.

Returns

left top coordinate of the stimulus patch within the full stimulus.

Return type

(int, int)

_get_stimulus_patch(self, stimulus)#

Selects a patch of the stimulus.

Parameters

stimulus (ndarray[ndarray[float]]) – the full stimulus.

Returns

the luminance matrix of a patch of the stimulus.

Return type

ndarray[ndarray[float]]
